description: Undulating palindromic primes: numbers that are prime, palindromic in base 10, and the digits alternate: ababab... with a != b.
references: C. A. Pickover, "Wonders of Numbers", Oxford New York 2001, Chapter 52, pp. 123-124, 316-317.
C. W. Trigg, Palindromic Octagonal Numbers, Journal of Recreational Mathematics, 15:1, pp. 41-46, 1982-83.
links: R. Ondrejka, The Top Ten: a Catalogue of Primal Configurations
C. A. Pickover, "Wonders of Numbers, Adventures in Mathematics, Mind and Meaning," Zentralblatt review
maple: for l from 3 to 31 by 2 do for i from 0 to 9 do for j from 0 to 9 do it1 := sum(i*10^(2*k), k=0..(l-1)/2): it2 := sum(j*10^(2*k+1), k=0..(l-3)/2): if isprime(it1+it2) and i<>j then printf(`%d, `,it1+it2) fi: od: od: od: # _James A. Sellers_, Feb 13 2001
mathematica: t = {}; t1 = {1, 3, 7, 9}; Do[p = 10 a + b; q = 10 b + a; t = Join[t, Select[Table[(p*10^(2 n + 1) - q)/99, {n, 4}], PrimeQ]], {a, t1}, {b, Range[0, 9]}]; Union[t] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jun 23 2013 *)
prog: (Python)from sympy import isprimeA059758_list = []for l in range(1,300):....for a in '1379':........for b in '0123456789':............if a != b:................p = int((a+b)*l+a)................if isprime(p):....................A059758_list.append(p) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Dec 21 2014
author: _Jeff Heleen_, Feb 11 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Feb 13 2001
